meanings.definition: A flightless seabird of the Southern Hemisphere, having webbed feet and wings reduced to flippers.
meanings.sent1: Penguins waddle on land because they cannot fly.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of penguins swimming gracefully in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: Why did the penguin bring a suitcase to the beach? To have a flipper-flop vacation!
meanings.sent4: In a world of soaring birds, penguins are the elegant swimmers with tuxedos.
meanings.sent5: The penguins' flippers propel them through the icy waters like sleek torpedoes.

meanings.definition: A black-and-white bird that cannot fly but uses its small wings to help it swim.
meanings.sent1: The penguins at the zoo delighted the children with their playful antics.
meanings.sent2: Penguins are excellent divers, using their wings to navigate underwater.
meanings.sent3: What do you call a penguin in the desert? Lost!
meanings.sent4: The penguin's wings are like oars in the sea of ice, guiding it effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The black-and-white penguins stand out against the snowy backdrop, a picture of contrast.
